description: Work right around the corner from here and our bldg was invited for there opening preview so we got to receive a free lunch and I must say the sandwiches were delicious and the pickeled beets were great the only thing I did not like was the soup that particular day but otherwise I can see this place being here for awhile. good luck to them for taking on this adventure.
author: Vivian H.

description: oatmeal. Ginger scone. You won't find better! I would give another star if the coffee was great, to me, it isn't even close to great. But the oatmeal is so good, if you're an oatmeal fan you really should try it.
author: James P.

description: I tried this place for lunch today and found the food to be fresh and quite nice. I had the farro salad with chicken and enjoyed it. My colleague had the soup and liked it a lot (although she found herself wishing for more salt). The portions are somewhat small for the price and the flavors are subtle but it is a solid place for a healthy lunch.
author: Shani A.

description:
Finally a healthy AND delicious lunch place in downtown SF! 
I went there for their opening party this weekend where all items on the menu had been prepared and I sampled each one. Their roasted onion sandwich on focaccia was to die for (I had 3), and so was the raw kale salad with avocado dressing and the chickpea and quinoa salad. You can immediately tell that what they are doing is miles away from your run-of-the-mill "deli" (of which there are 3 within a block), the ingredients they use are all top notch (locally sourced organic produce, ACME bread, in-house slow roasted turkey meat, etc) and every item on the menu is not only beautifully crafted but flavorful and complex. They make their own mayo and do their own pickling or veggies (I wish you could buy jars of their pickled onions and carrots).
Ordering options are straightforward yet creative (you can choose a combo with 1, 2 or 3 items, mixing and matching sandwiches and salads).
The space is sleek and unpretentious and the staff is super friendly and proud of what they are doing.
author: Andreas B.

description: I was really excited to try this place, but was really disappointed. The ambiance is clean cut, minimalistic, and fresh. The spicy coppa sandwich was small and just average. My friend ordered the quinoa salad and said it was gross and didn't finish it. I probably won't come here again unless they add some new items to the menu.
author: Cathy L.

description: The food was fine but none of the 12 people (no exaggeration) came out in the 40 minutes I was there to clean up the dirty tables, which turned into 6 by the time I left.  I sat at a dirty table because that was all that was left.  I don't think I'll go back.
author: J. D.

description: Unquestionably the best lunch in downtown San Francisco, with prepared food that can go head-to-head with Bi-Rite Market. No joke! The design of the space is awesome, the food is delicious, and the people are great. Try the sweet potatoes, farro salad, and roast beef sandwich (yes, its happy meat). Delicious. Bravo, Heyday.
author: Lenny N.

description: Ordered the 2-item combo with the Chickpeas & Quinoa Salad and Cabbage & Chicken Slaw. $10 is pretty standard for lunch in the FiDi, esp for a healthy spot like this (comparing it to The Plant...which is 5 blocks away). This is a block from my office which is super convenient, and the ever-changing menu keeps it fresh. The flavors were awesome in both salads. My only gripe with the Cabbage and Chicken Slaw was the three tiny shreds of chicken I got -_- Overall pretty legit. I'll try more from them when I don't pack lunch.
author: Lauren Q.

description: excellent organic healthy food downtown.  Got the turkey sandwich and the potato leek soup (not creamy).  Both excellent.  I'll be back.
author: Heinz G.

description: Anywhere i can reliably/quickly get a tasty kale salad and well-cooked grains is a-okay in my book.  Super bonus for the organic + health & a good selection of vegan/veggie options.  Hoping they're planning to rotate some new salads in as the season changes.
author: Sierra S.

description: This place is really cute on the inside.  The food is a bit pricey though.  It's healthy and fresh but everything is cold....and for that it shouldn't be so expensive.  Their options are also limited.  I've tried this place one time and it was ok....I'm not sure if I can confidently say that I'd return.
author: Samantha S.

description: Love, love, love this place. Hearty, wholesome, delicious. They have the Midas touch with kale, soups are invariably delish and the baked goods are to die for. I hear they may be expanding? I hope so!!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great healthy lunch option.  A bit pricey, but so are the other nearby options - this is downtown SF after all.  Line can be long, but moves quickly.
author: Lauren K.

description: I'll be honest, I love the fact that this place is right across the street from my office but even if it wasn't its a great quick-grab lunch spot.  The food is tasty, healthy and reasonably priced and the staff works quickly and is always friendly.  I would give them a 5th star but I would like to see a little more variety in the soups and salads (again with the lentils & kale??? :-)  Recommended!
author: Steve G.

description:
Giving this 2 stars instead of 3 in hopes of changing it for the better!

Likes: 
- eco-friendly
- cute decor
- well-sourced ingredients
- decent food
- near my office

Dislikes:
- I'm already tired of the non-changing menu.
- TINY PORTIONS for too much money.

Seriously...I'm usually the last person to complain about portion size or paying more for better quality food, however, when I spend $10 or more I do expect to be sated. And this ain't doin' it. 

They should take a look at Il Cane Rosso, which is WAY better in my opinion. You get just enough more for your money, the menu changes all the time and the food is amazing. The food at Heyday is just okay; I feel like the original recipes were probably right-on but the daily execution suffers slightly. The sandwiches are good but not mind-blowing...the kale salad is good, but slightly too tangy (for me). Most dishes I've tried just need slight adjustments or a little more oomph. Nothing strikes as something I couldn't easily make at home.

Portion wise, just make them slightly bigger! Everybody I know who has eaten here has commented - negatively - about the size, and many of my male colleagues won't be going back.
author: Jasmine W.

description: Great, healthy salads and coffees. THE BEST chocolate chip walnut cookies I ever ate (and I am a connoisseur). Nice customer service too - they do the right thing when needed - impressive.
author: Good C.

description: Hey-I'm-Still-Hungry.  The food is good and goumet, but you need to order the 3 item lunch option for any sort of reasonable caloric intake and that is $14.  Hence the 3 stars.  It's bordering on ridiculous.  The sandwich had less than an ounce of meat on it, too.  I work half a block away, so I was hoping this would be a viable lunch option. It's really not.  They either need to increase the portion sizes or adjust the pricing.  I'm hoping they tweak their approach a bit.  This one has potential.
author: Gary R.

description: Well, hmmm.  They seemed to put more chicken in the chicken salad for a couple weeks, but the last two times I tried it there was hardly any.  I really like the *idea* of Heyday; just not thrilled with the execution.  Will have to go elsewhere.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Totally overpriced, bland, unambitious food in a cheap setting.  My turkey sandwich was the definition of meh.  The kale salad was fresh, but boring and too bitter from all of the lemon juice.  I won't be going back.  There are way too many good sandwiches to enjoy in this area to settle for this stuff.  I can't believe I paid this much for a blad, PRE-MADE sandwich.
author: Otto D.

description: I have to say I have been here a few times and love the concept and have somewhat enjoyed my meals. Today I stopped in to grab an oatmeal and was disgusted by what I saw happening behind the counter. A man who was cutting veggies for something was texting on his cell phone, then continued to cut veggies ( Do you know how many germs are on the average cell phone?!?!?!)! Then proceded to touch the cabinets and the milk container that others use for coffee- ALL WITH OUT WASHING HIS HANDS!!!! I would love to have this be a nice healthy change from the run of the mill lunch spot but am afraid I was turned off today for good. HEYDAY EMPLOYEES PLEASE WASH YOUR HANDS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Marie G.

description: Fresh and delicious - a welcome addition to the lunch options in the neighborhood!  They have increased the portion sizes since opening as a result of feedback.  All around great place!
author: Sean K.

description: The chicken dinner is excellent. The chicken is roasted unlike supermarket rotisserie chicken. It is quite tasty and moist and is served with a large portion of tasty farro and some roasted carrots. A whole chicken fed 2 for dinner with enough left over for 2 lunches.  It's restaurant quality at about half the price but twice the price of say a supermarket meal. I would prefer more vegtables or a salad but as it is, I'll be back.
author: Rick G.
